file_content.text: Thanks again for your work. Makes me proud.
You need to meet up with Major Shellaster before it's too late!
This is worse than I ever would have imagined. Lord Grathan's behind this. He has to be!
I know Lord Grathan and his wife. A scheming, troubled family.
I know that rogue.
A clever one, Lord Grathan. Poking at the Dark Council without ever causing them to raise their fist.
I know that rogue.
I've faced Lord Grathan and his renegade forces. What's he done now?
I know that rogue.
Lord Grathan is a threat to the stability of Dromund Kaas.
I know that rogue.
I do not know Lord Grathan. Should I?
Who is Lord Grathan?
I thought I knew all the players on Dromund Kaas, but I don't know that one.
Who is Lord Grathan?
Never heard of this "Lord Grathan."
Who is Lord Grathan?
Is this someone I should be familiar with?
Who is Lord Grathan?
He's a rogue Sith who broke away but keeps himself enough allies in Kaas City to not be attacked.
Make some sense, idiot.
Fill me in.
He's covered his tracks well--we won't be able to prove it--but Lord Grathan has been sending security codes and planetary readouts offworld.
Everything an invading army would need.
Major Shellaster is already on route to the probable invasion site, with every soldier he can find. They'll meet you just across the bridge, hurry!
Back already? And you have the transmitters?
Just take them already.
They're yours.
It was nothing.
Well, what do you know--and here I was starting to think efficiency had gone out of style. I owe you thanks.
Don't act too surprised, I'll think you had no faith in me.
No need to be startled.
You're right. I owe you thanks.
If you'll give me a moment, I'll upload the data to High Command and we'll see what's what.
We need those transmitters before Kaas City's schematics get to the wrong people.
Damn it--this never would have happened on my watch.
Ah, my lord, it's good to see that the Sith haven't let things slide--not like the rest of this circus of an Empire.
No offense, hunter, but we were better off before the war, when we were still closed to the rest of the galaxy.
I hope you're taking notes, agent.
This place is going downhill fast.
First it's slave rebellions in the jungle, then this! We wouldn't have allowed these kinds of things thirty years ago.
What's the problem, officer?
Explain.
You've lost me.
If it's so serious, get help from the Imperial military and leave me alone.
I can't be bothered.
There isn't time for that.
I was sent to this construction site to investigate unusual behavior among the droids. I wasn't here long when one of the units attacked me.
I barely escaped with my life--but worse than that, I found this transmitter on the droid.
What's so bad about finding a transmitter?
What's the issue?
These are not Imperial issue transmitters. They are being used to control the droids and receive data from them in return.
Do you think the droids were being controlled by someone?
That doesn't sound good.
Yes, and I believe they're sending signals back as well.
Yawn.
It's apathy that's destroying this Empire from the inside out.
I warned my superiors what would happen if they continued to be lax about this planet's security.
Someone--an independent interest, a rogue Sith Lord--is using these droids to broadcast Kaas City's schematics to an off-planet location.
When I find whoever is behind this, they will learn what becomes of those who cross the Sith.
Someone's going to pay.
I hope you do, but with all respect, I think it's important that we stop the outgoing flow of information, first.
How did someone manage to plant the transmitters?
This is a serious breach.
I don't know. I warned them about using unsupervised droids. In my day, we would've used slaves--heavily guarded slaves.
You want me to blow up some droids or what?
I got my blaster ready.
And the mission?
I don't have time for this.
I'm very busy right now.
That kind of lackadaisical attitude is what's bringing this Empire down.
We need to get those transmitters. If we can remove enough of them from the droids, it'll make the data they're sending unintelligible.
The sooner we get those transmitters out, the better. This information can't end up in the hands of our enemies!
Sorry, I've got too much on my mind right now.
